violations.description: Potential violation of: Unused import
violations.suggested_fix: Remove unused imports to keep the code clean and reduce memory usage. Unused imports can confuse developers about dependencies.
violations.rule_description: Remove unused imports to keep the code clean and reduce memory usage. Unused imports can confuse developers about dependencies.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Import should be at top of file
violations.suggested_fix: All imports should be at the top of the file, after module docstrings and before module globals and constants.
violations.rule_title: Import should be at top of file
violations.rule_description: All imports should be at the top of the file, after module docstrings and before module globals and constants.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Avoid wildcard imports
violations.suggested_fix: Avoid using 'from module import *' as it pollutes the namespace and makes it unclear where names come from.
violations.rule_description: Avoid using 'from module import *' as it pollutes the namespace and makes it unclear where names come from.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Use list comprehension instead of loop
violations.suggested_fix: List comprehensions are more Pythonic and often faster than equivalent for loops for creating lists.
violations.rule_title: Use list comprehension instead of loop
violations.rule_description: List comprehensions are more Pythonic and often faster than equivalent for loops for creating lists.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Line too long
violations.suggested_fix: Limit all lines to a maximum of 79 characters for code, or 72 for comments and docstrings. Long lines reduce readability.
violations.rule_description: Limit all lines to a maximum of 79 characters for code, or 72 for comments and docstrings. Long lines reduce readability.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Function is too complex
violations.suggested_fix: Functions with high cyclomatic complexity (>10) are difficult to understand, test, and maintain. Consider breaking into smaller functions.
violations.rule_description: Functions with high cyclomatic complexity (>10) are difficult to understand, test, and maintain. Consider breaking into smaller functions.

violations.description: Potential violation of: Function name should be lowercase
violations.suggested_fix: Function names should be lowercase with words separated by underscores (snake_case). This follows Python naming conventions.
violations.rule_description: Function names should be lowercase with words separated by underscores (snake_case). This follows Python naming conventions.
